Name: B-Dublin (CBL)
Source: BM = Lady Meux Ethiopic manuscripts described by Budge, One Hundred; Lady Meux 2 and 3 (publ. by Budge 1900, 1922 and 1923 [s. above]) are now ms. Oslo – London, Schøyen Collection, Ms. 248 (formerly Lady Meux 2 [= ms. A in CerMaria], ca. 1682–1706, 39 miracles) and ms. Dublin, Chester Beatty Library 914 (formerly Lady Meux 3 [= ms. B in CerMaria], cp. Cerulli 1965a: 290f., 40 miracles).”

Name: B-Oslo (SCOL)
Source: BM = Lady Meux Ethiopic manuscripts described by Budge, One Hundred; Lady Meux 2 and 3 (publ. by Budge 1900, 1922 and 1923 [s. above]) are now ms. Oslo – London, Schøyen Collection, Ms. 248 (formerly Lady Meux 2 [= ms. A in CerMaria], ca. 1682–1706, 39 miracles) and ms. Dublin, Chester Beatty Library 914 (formerly Lady Meux 3 [= ms. B in CerMaria], cp. Cerulli 1965a: 290f., 40 miracles).”

Name: BOr (BL)
Source: Pre-1877-acquired Christian Orient Collections (Wright Catalog), Post-1877-acquired Christian Orient Collections (Strelcyn catalog). British Library founded in 1970s, and most all mss transferred from British Museum to British Library.
Notes: Strelcyn catalog: in Princeton library. Temporary digital access: https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015034710536&view=1up&seq=64

Name: BAdd (BL)
Source: "Add MS" Collections of British Library, none appear to have been in the Strelcyn or Wright catalog

Name: C-Berlin (BS)
Source: CBS [Cerulli 1957] = manuscript of the Berlin Staatsbibliothek described by Cerulli, Enrico 1957. ‘Il Codice della Staatsbibliothek di Berlino del Libro dei Miracoli di Maria’, Rivista degli Studi Orientali, 32 (1957), 337–396. Belcher looked this up and got place name for the one manuscript

Name: C-Dublin (CBL)
Source: CCBE [Cerulli 1965a] = manuscripts of the Chester Beatty Library described by Cerulli, Enrico 1965. ‘I manoscritti etiopici della Chester Beatty Library in Dublino’, Atti della Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei, Classe di Scienze morali, storiche e filologiche: Memorie, serie 8, volume 11, fascicolo 6 (1965), 277–324.
Notes: Interlibrary loan request failed because of COVID-19. Worldcat: https://www.worldcat.org/title/manoscritti-etiopici-della-chester-beatty-library-in-dublino/oclc/50921770/editions?editionsView=true&referer=br.

Name: C-Florence (BNCF)
Institution Name: Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenze (National Central Library of Florence)
Source: CF [Cerulli 1943a, 24-25 and 44-47] = manuscripts of the Biblioteca Nazionale of Florence (two manuscripts bound together in a single codex) described in Cerulli, Enrico 1943. Il libro etiopico dei Miracoli di Maria e le sue fonti nelle letterature del Medio Evo latino, Studi orientali pubblicati a cura della Scuola Orientale, 1 (Roma: Dott. Giovanni Bardi Editore, 1943), 24-25 and 44-47.
Notes: Interlibrary loan request failed because of COVID-19. Print book in Princeton Theological Seminary https://www.worldcat.org/title/libro-etiopico-dei-miracoli-di-maria-e-le-sue-fonti-nelle-letterature-del-medioevo-latino/oclc/868579117/editions?sd=desc&referer=br&se=yr&qt=facet_yr%3A&editionsView=true&fq=yr%3A1943; link to Princeton library ReCAP https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/SCSB-4167747

Name: C-Leningrad (RAN)
Institution Name: Rossíiskaya akadémiya naúk (Academy of Sciences of Leningrad)
Source: CL [Cerulli 1965b] = manuscript of the Academy of Sciences of Leningrad described by Cerulli, Enrico 1965. ‘Il codice di Leningrado del libro etiopico dei Miracoli di Maria’, Rendiconti delle adunanze solenni dell’Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei, Classe di scienze morali, storiche e filologiche, ser. 8, 20 (1965), 1–19.

Name: C-Veroli (BGV)
Source: G [Cerulli 1943a, 24 and 27-36] = manuscript of the Biblioteca Giovardiana in Veroli described in Cerulli, Enrico 1943. Il libro etiopico dei Miracoli di Maria e le sue fonti nelle letterature del Medio Evo latino, Studi orientali pubblicati a cura della Scuola Orientale, 1 (Roma: Dott. Giovanni Bardi Editore, 1943), 24 and 27-36.
Notes: Interlibrary loan request failed because of COVID-19. Print book in Princeton Theological Seminary https://www.worldcat.org/title/libro-etiopico-dei-miracoli-di-maria-e-le-sue-fonti-nelle-letterature-del-medioevo-latino/oclc/868579117/editions?sd=desc&referer=br&se=yr&qt=facet_yr%3A&editionsView=true&fq=yr%3A1943; link to Princeton library ReCAP https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/SCSB-4167747

Name: CR-Paris (BNF)
Institution Name: Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France)
Source: CRA [Conti Rossini 1914] = manuscripts of the Bibliothèque nationale de France in Paris, d’Abbadie Collection described by Conti Rossini, Carlo 1914. Notice sur les manuscrits éthiopiens de la Collection d’Abbadie, Extrait du Journal Asiatique (Paris: Imprimerie nationale, 1914).

Name: Duke (Duke)
Source: DULE = Ethiopian manuscripts of the Duke University Library, Durham, North Carolina (microfilms preserved in HMML; unpublished description by W.F.Macomber available there).

Name: EMDL (HMML)
Source: Ethiopian Manuscript Digital Library, digitized by Meley Mulugetta, digital copies of manuscripts in Ethiopia, deposited at HMML

Name: EMIP (EMIP)
Source: Ethiopian Manuscript Imaging Project, digital copies of manuscripts in Ethiopia by Steve Delamarter, deposited at BetaM so maybe list that as the Institution Name

Name: EMML (HMML)
Source: EMML [Macomber 1975, 1976, 1978; Getatchew Haile and Macomber 1979; Getatchew Haile 1981a; Getatchew Haile and Macomber 1982, 1983] = Macomber, William F. 1975. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Microfilm Library, Collegeville. Vol. I: Project Numbers 1–300 (Collegeville, MN: Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, 1975); Macomber, William F. 1976. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Microfilm Library, Collegeville. Vol. II: Project Numbers 301-700 (Collegeville, MN: Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, 1976); Macomber, William F. 1978. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Microfilm Library, Collegeville. Vol. III: Project Numbers 701–1100 (Collegeville, MN: Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, 1978); Getatchew Haile and William F. Macomber 1979. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Microfilm Library, Collegeville. Vol. IV: Project Numbers 1101-1500 (Collegeville, MN: Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, 1979); Getatchew Haile 1981. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa, and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, Collegeville, Vol. V: Project Numbers 1501-2000 (Collegeville, MN: HMML, 1981); Getatchew Haile and William F. Macomber 1982. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa, and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, Collegeville, Vol. VI: Project Numbers 2001-2500 (Collegeville, MN: HMML, 1982); Getatchew Haile and William F. Macomber 1983. A catalogue of Ethiopian manuscripts microfilmed for the Ethiopian Manuscript Microfilm Library, Addis Ababa, and for the Hill Monastic Manuscript Library, Collegeville, Vol. VII: Project Numbers 2501-3000 (Collegeville, MN: HMML, 1983).
Notes: EMML 1-300: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog01/mode/2up; EMML 301-700: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog02/mode/2up; EMML 701-1100: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog03/mode/2up; EMML 1101-1500: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog04/mode/2up; EMML 1501-2000: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog05/mode/2up; EMML 2001-2500: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog06/mode/2up; EMML 2501-3000: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog07/mode/2up; EMML 3001-3500: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog08/mode/2up; EMML 3501-4000: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog09/mode/2up; EMML 4001-5000: https://archive.org/details/EMMLCatalog10/mode/2up

Name: G-Milan (BAM)
Source: GBAE [Grébaut 1933–1934] = manuscripts of the Biblioteca Ambrosiana in Milan described by Grébaut, Sylvain 1933–1934. ‘Catalogue des manuscrits éthiopiens de la Bibliothèque Ambrosienne’, Revue de l’Orient Chrétien, 29 (1933–1934), 3–32.

Name: G-Vatican (BAV)
Source: GVE [Grébaut and Tisserant 1935, 1936] = manuscripts of the Vatican Library described by Grébaut, Sylvain and Eugène Tisserant 1935. Bybliothecae apostolicae Vaticanae codices manu scripti recensiti iussu Pii XI Pontificis maximi. Codices Aethiopici Vaticani et Borgiani, Barberinianus orientalis 2, Rossianus 865, I: Enarratio codicum (Città del Vaticano: In Bybliotheca Vaticana, 1935); Grébaut, Sylvain and Eugène Tisserant 1936. Bybliothecae apostolicae Vaticanae codices manu scripti recensiti iussu Pii XI Pontificis maximi. Codices Aethiopici Vaticani et Borgiani, Barberinianus orientalis 2, Rossianus 865, II: Prolegomena, Indices, Tabulae (Città del Vaticano: In Bybliotheca Vaticana, 1936).

Name: GEM (PUL)
Source: Princeton University, Firestone Library, Rare Books and Special Collections; Garrett Ethiopic manuscripts, collected in Ethiopia

Name: H-Berlin (BS)
Source: HBS [Hammerschmidt and Six 1983] = Hammerschmidt, Ernst and Veronika Six 1983. Äthiopische Handschriften 1: Die Handschriften der Staatsbibliothek Preussischer Kulturbesitz, Verzeichnis der orientalischen Handschriften in Deutschland, 20/4 (Wiesbaden: Steiner, 1983).

Name: L-Uppsala (UU)
Source: LUE [Löfgren 1974] = Löfgren, Oscar 1974. Katalog über die äthiopischen Handschriften in der Universitätsbibliothek Uppsala sowie Anhänge über äthiopische Handschriften in anderen Bibliotheken und in Privatbesitz in Schweden, Acta Bibliothecae R. Universitatis Upsaliensis, 18 (Uppsala: Almqvist & Wiksell, 1974).

Name: M-Dourgne (AEC)
Source: AECE = Abbaye d’En Calcat, Dourgne, France, Ethiopic MS. (microfilm preserved in HMML; unpublished description by W.F. Macomber available there). Cannot look up, catalog unpublished, although perhaps the monastery has new information online

Name: M-SWE (SWE)
Source: SWE [Macomber 1979] = Macomber, William F. 1979. ‘Catalogue of Oriental Manuscripts in the Library of Seabury-Western Theological Seminary, Evanston, Illinois’, Le Muséon, 92 (1979), 369–386.

Name: PEM (PUL)
Source: Princeton University, Firestone Library, Rare Books and Special Collections; all Ethiopian manuscripts purchased or donated to the library after the Garrett collection

Name: S-Paris (BNF)
Institution Name: Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France)
Source: SGE [Strelcyn 1954] = Strelcyn, Stefan 1954. Catalogue des manuscrits éthiopiens (Collection Griaule). Tome IV: Éthiopien 373 (Griaule 69) - Éthiopien 301-304, 675-687 (Paris: Imprimerie nationale, 1954).

Name: S-Rome (ANL)
Source: SALE [Strelcyn 1976] = Strelcyn, Stefan 1976. Catalogue des manuscrits éthiopiens de l’Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei. Fonds Conti Rossini et Fonds Caetani 209, 375, 376, 377, 378, Indici e Sussidi Bibliografici della Biblioteca, 9 (Roma: Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei, 1976).

Name: T-Saint Petersburg (IVR)
Institution Name: Institut Vostočnyh Rukopisej Rossijskoj Akademii Nauk
Source: Turaev, B. 1906. Ėfiopskija rukopisi v S.-Peterburgě, Pamjatniki ėfiopskoj pis’mennosti, 3 (St Petersburg: Tipografija imperatorskoj Akademii Nauk, 1906), page 37-45

Name: VL-Vatican (BAV)
Source: VLVE [van Lantschoot 1962] = van Lantschoot, Arnold 1962. ‘Inventaire sommaire des mss. vaticans éthiopiens 251-299’, in Collectanea Vaticana in onorem Anselmi M. Card. Albareda a Bibiotheca Apostolica edita, I, Studi e Testi, 219 (Città del Vaticano: Biblioteca Apostolica Vaticana, 1962), 453–512.

Name: Z-Paris (BNF)
Institution Name: Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France)
Source: ZBNE = Ethiopian manuscripts of the Bibliotheque Nationale in Paris described by H. ZOTENBERG

Name: TGS (EOTC)
Source: Printed EOTC books, with Ge`ez and Amharic translations

Name: S-London (BL)
Source: SBLE [Strelcyn 1978] = Strelcyn, Stefan 1978. Catalogue of Ethiopian Manuscripts in the British Library acquired since the Year 1877 (London: British Museum, 1978).
Notes: Do not use "S-London" for these mss. Only use British Library shelfmarks. In Princeton library. Temporary digital access: https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015034710536&view=1up&seq=64

Name: W-London (BM)
Source: WBLE [Wright 1877] = Wright, William 1877. Catalogue of the Ethiopic Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1847 (London: Gilbert and Rivington, 1877).
Notes: Do not use "W-London" for these mss. Only use British Library shelfmarks. We originally had one manuscript from the British Library Orient collection, W-London 77 (BL Orient 652 in the catalog). The collection was cataloged by Wright, but he didn't include miracles descriptions. Dorothea Reule recataloged this manuscript by adding miracles records in May 2020, and we changed the name from W-London 77 to BLEM 652. Internet Archive: https://archive.org/details/catalogueofethio00brituoft/page/n6/mode/2up. In Princeton library, temporary digital access: https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=umn.31951001790762o&view=1up&seq=1. WorldCat: https://www.worldcat.org/title/catalogue-of-the-ethiopic-manuscripts-in-the-british-museum-acquired-since-the-year-1847-by-w-wright/oclc/561861416&referer=brief_results

Name: WP (EOTC)
Collection Name: Qʷäraṣa (Walatta Petros's Monastery), called Korata in EMML
Source: in VOHD? check See Belcher book on WP for general information about monastery
Notes: Qorata, Korata, Qoratsa, etc for names. I thought it would be interesting, becuase it quite likely has unique miracles in it, things that happened to WP and the kings who took asylum there

Name: TC (HUSD)
Collection Name: Howard University School of Divinity, Tweed Codex

Name: EMDA (HMML)
Source: HMML funded this project, sometime in the 2010s, in a private project with a worker or two in Ethiopia.  It may have been Mersha, or it may have been Haile Mariam

Name: DSAE (HMML)
Source: Use the monastery's location

Name: IES-286 (EAP)
Source: Steve Delamarter and Demeke Berhane digitized at the Institute of Ethiopian Studies, Addis Ababa, 2010

Name: Ethio-SPaRe (UH)
Source: Denis Nosnitsin's project; Massive project digitizing at many monasteries and churches. The format is "Ethio-SPaRe DZ 120" was digitized at the Monastery of Dabra Zayt.

Name: Davies (HMML)
Source: 1968 Dr Donald Davies collected 35 manuscripts at twenty-three monasteries in Ethiopia (inc Gunda Gunde); his images are at HMML

Name: UNESCO (HMML)
Source: Team microfilmed in Ethiopia 1969-1970; scans of non-EMML microfilms re kept at HMML from the UNESCO and Ernst Hammerschmidt Tanasee projects of the 1960s

Name: GG (HMML)
Source: Michael Gervers digitized at the Gunda Gunde monastery

Name: JerPat (EOTC)
Source: But MS. JE327E is EMIP02585. One is a Library of Congress project and available through their website.  Another was done through Brigham Young. Both of these were done decades ago.

Name: VOHD (HMML)
Collection Name: Tanasee; Verzeichnis der orientalischen Handschriften in Deutschland
Source: Microfilmed by Hammerscmidt in late 1960s around Lake Tana; often called Tanasee project or VOHD; catalogued in Äthiopische Handschriften vom Ṭānāsee; ketp at HMML

Name: G-340 (EAP)
Source: Gervers digitized at at least four Tigray monasteries; this is Däbrä Särabi.

Name: M-357 EMDL (EAP)
Source: Meley Mulugetta Bazzabeh digitzed in Tigray in 2010; these all are likely a dup of EMDL Identifying endangered monastic collections in the Säharti and Enderta regions of Tigray (Ethiopia) (EAP357)

Name: G-526 (EAP)
Source: Gervers digitized at at least four Tigray monasteries; this is May Wäyni Monastery in 2012

Name: G-704 (EAP)
Collection Name: Marawe Krestos & Däbrä Abbay Monasteries, Tigray
Source: Gervers digitized at at least four Tigray monasteries; this is Marawe Krestos and Däbrä Abbay in 2014

Name: N-254 (EAP)
Collection Name: Romanat Qeddus Mikael Dabre Mehret, Enderta, Tigray
Source: Denis Nosnitsin digitised the library in the church Romanat Qeddus Mikael Dabre Mehret, Enderta. The library possesses around 70 codices and includes several valuable manuscripts of high quality, some of them with illuminations and valuable marginalia

Name: M-432 EMDA (EAP)
Collection Name: Dabra Koreb & Qarāneyo Madḫānē Alam Monastery, Gojjam
Source: Mersha Alehegne Mengistie digitised 61 manuscripts from the monastery Debre Koreb we Qeranyo Medhane’Alem. Documenting the written heritage of East Goğğam: a rich culture in jeopardy (EAP432); Delamarter uses TM for Qemer he calls "EAP 432/1/4, G1-IV-343-4" and "EMDA 162, G1-IV-288 = EAP 432/1/13"  and EMDA 180, G1-IV-295 = EAP 432/1/37

Name: BLC (EOTC)
Source: Early TM in pdf (or maybe not!). Microfilm (but we have color pdf so?). Donald Crummey, Illinois/IES 88.XXIV; King Dawit's land donation to Beta Lahem in Gayant, a church founded by the king's daughter, Dal Mägäsa (or Dal Mängäsa)

Name: TQ (EOTC)
Source: Publisher: Ṭana Qirqos Communal Monastery. The source manuscript (or manuscripts) is not mentioned.
Notes: Text and translations are taken from Amsalu Tefera. 2015. The Ethiopian homily on the Ark of the Covenant : critical edition and annotated translation of Dersanä Ṣeyon. Texts and studies in Eastern Christianity, volume 5. Boston : Brill.
